feed.title: SAP Community - ABAP Development
feed.subtitle: ABAP Development Q&A in SAP Community

entry.title: ME2N “Still to be Delivered” quantity calculation logic
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

I am developing a custom Purchase Order report and I am trying to replicate the standard SAP logic used in transaction ME2N.

I need to calculate the field “Still to be Delivered” exactly as shown in ME2N. Since this value is not stored directly in any single table, I tried to derive it based on schedule line and goods receipt data.

Currently, I am using the following logic:
Still to be Delivered = EKET-MENGE – EKET-WEMNG
Where:
EKET-MENGE = Scheduled Quantity
EKET-WEMNG = Quantity already received via Goods Receipt
However, in some cases, the calculated value in my report does not match the ME2N output, which indicates that ME2N is applying additional business logic.
Therefore, I would like to understand the complete standard logic used by ME2N for this calculation.

Could you please confirm whether ME2N also considers the following during this calculation:
Delivery completed indicator (EKPO-ELIKZ)
Final delivery flag (EKPO-EREKZ)
Deleted schedule lines (EKET-LOEKZ)
Reversed GR quantities from EKBE
Multiple schedule lines per PO item

If there is any standard function module, class, or BAPI used internally by ME2N to derive this value, kindly suggest.

Thanks in advance for your guidance.

Best Regards,
Ashok

entry.title: Adobe Forms: best approach for long texts with mixed formatting and dynamic lengt
entry.content:
Hello,

I am creating my first Adobe Form and I have some doubts about how to design its structure.

The form I need to build has the first 3 pages containing a large amount of text, divided into several paragraphs. Each paragraph has a title that must be displayed in bold, followed by normal text.

Inside some of these paragraphs I need to insert “floating” fields. Most of the time these fields will contain short values, but in some cases they may contain long text, so the paragraphs can grow dynamically and flow across pages.

My initial idea was to maintain all the text as a standard text (SO10), read it using READ_TEXT, and then replace the required variables in ABAP before passing the final string to the form.

However, my doubt is related to the paragraph titles that must be in bold. As far as I understand, it is not possible to have part of a text in bold and another part in normal style within the same text object in Adobe Forms. This also seems not possible even using JavaScript. Is that correct?

If this is not possible, my alternative idea would be to split the content into multiple elements: one bold text for each paragraph title, followed by one standard text for the paragraph itself, for example:

 
FORM TITLE

Paragraph title 1
Standard text 1

Paragraph title 2
Standard text 2

Paragraph title 3
Standard text 3

With this approach, my intention would be to place all these elements inside the first body page, allowing the page to grow dynamically based on the length of the texts and the substituted variables. This way, all paragraphs would flow one after another without forced page breaks or unnecessary white spaces.

Any guidance or best practices would be appreciated.

entry.title: UoM changed in Va02 not reflecting in MB51
entry.content:
Hi,

A sales order is created in VA01 with order quantity in bottles. After saving the order, the entry is showing in MB51.  Then the user goes to VA02 to change the unit from bottles to Cases. After saving the order when checking MB51, the new units (CS) and the converted quantity not showing in the list of MB51. 

When debugged, I could see that MSEG table is not hit for any updates during the process and I can see that MB51 fields are coming from MSEG.

I would like to understand if this is expected behavior or if there is anything I am missing. If I cannot see the changes in MB51, where should I check?

Thanks in advance!

entry.title: Using SAP Trademark/Screenshot and own videos "using SAP products" to create training content
entry.content:
Dear team,

 

my company plans to craete a video training course for people to loarn ABAP develpment using the SAP BTP ABAP environment and ABAP Development tools.

The video training course is planned to be published on a large online learning platform and would be need to be bought by the trainee.

The videos will show and use the followign SAP products/trademarks first an a short slide presentation as Intro and second in the video traning itself:

-Trademarks: SAP, SAP ABAP, , etc.

-Screenshots: SAP BTP ABAP environment, ABAP Development tools

-Product training: SAP BTP ABAP environment, ABAP Development tools

We reviewed  copyright and trademark notice( Informationen über Urheberrechte | About SAP) but could not find more details about using SAP trademarks, screenshots and products in online learnings offers.

What we can see is that many companies create content in their own name and use SAP's trademark and products for that on the large online learning platoforms like udemy and co. Can anybody support on the question if this is allowed to do so?

entry.title: value of MCHB-CLABS always returns as 0 in AMDP SQLScript
entry.content:
Below is the AMDP query, I dont know why for all 3 approaches I am getting clabs, clabs2, clabs3 value as 0.000 or 0 but never actual value. It does return a value in ABAP SQL. What am I doing wrong?

lt_mchb_base = SELECT

mchb.matnr,

mchb.charg,

mchb.clabs,

mchb.mandt,

mchb.ersda,

CAST(mchb.clabs AS DECIMAL(15, 3)) AS clabs2,

CAST(mchb.clabs AS DOUBLE ) AS clabs3,

mchb.werks,

mchb.lgort

FROM mchb WHERE mandt = SESSION_CONTEXT('CLIENT');

entry.content:

I am facing an issue in one of the message id and in sxmb_moni it is showing Queue status has errors but i am not able to see errors and no dumps in ST22. Please help me how to identify the errors.

Regards,

Ravi

entry.title: QM01 + workflow email subject issue.
entry.content:
Hi Friends,

In QM01, the notification triggers an email through a workflow. The email subject is taken from a custom class variable and mapped to the “Work Item Text”. However, when users log in with other languages, the email subject appears as an abbreviated description instead of the expected text.

Thanks with Regards,

Vallamuthu M.

entry.title: Need BAdI for Auto-Setting Validity Date in Sales Enquiries
entry.content:
Hi,

I have a requirement for sales enquiries (document type IN) where:

  1. Auto-Set Validity Date
    • When the enquiry is saved, if the Validity Date is empty, it should be automatically set to 30 days from the Enquiry Date.
  2. Freeze Item Quantity After Validity Expiry
    • If the current date is greater than the Validity Date:
      • User cannot change Item Quantity.
      • Other fields should remain editable.
  3. Restriction
    • This logic should apply only to Enquiries and must not affect Sales Orders or Quotations.

I have tried searching for a BAdI in SE18/SE19 and checked the following standard BAdIs, but none of them seem suitable:

BADI_SD_SALES, BADI_SD_SALES_BASIC,  BADI_SD_CM, BADI_LAYER, ADDR_PRINTFORM_SHORT, BADI_SD_SALES_ITEM, CHECK_COBL_ADDON, EHS_DG_002, ATP_PUBLISH_RESULTS, BADI_SD_TO_FM, BADI_ISPS_GRANT, DIP_UPDATE_FKDAT

Could anyone suggest which BAdI or enhancement point I can use to implement this requirement for sales enquiries only?

Thank you in advance!

entry.title: CX_DBA_PARSE_ERROR in DBACOCKPIT Dump History - ASE 16.0.04.07 on SAP Kernel 754
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

I am encountering a dump in DBACOCKPIT when trying to access Backup and Recovery -> Database Dump History.

Error Details:

  • Exception: CX_DBA_PARSE_ERROR

  • Class: CL_SYB_DBMS_UTILS

  • Method: CAST_FMT_TSTAMP_TO_DB6TSTAMP

  • Message: Unable to parse date/time.

System Environment:

  • SAP Kernel: 754 Patch 628 (64-bit Unicode)

  • DB Client Library: Sybase ASE 16.0.04.07

  • OS: SLES 15

What I have checked so far:

  1. OS Locales: The environment variables for sidadm and sybsid are set to en_US.UTF-8.

     

  2. https://me.sap.com/notes/2780872/E: I found this Note which describes the exact issue, but it only references older SAP Notes (for Basis 7.40) and does not provide specific correction instructions for Basis 754.

  3. Note 1558958: This collection note also seems to target older releases.

It seems like the ABAP parser cannot handle the date/time format returned by the ASE 16.0.04.07 engine.

Does anyone know the specific Correction Collection Note for SAP_BASIS 754 that addresses this timestamp parsing issue? Or is there a specific DB parameter/locale setting within ASE that could force a compatible date format?

Thanks in advance for your help!

entry.title: How to use Custom Logic App to pass Contract Header data to Sales Order header?
entry.content:
I'm fairly new on with CleanCore approach. 

For passing the data of Contract Header into Call off Sales Order header, which extension point will be used? is SD_SLS_MODIFY_HEAD correct? I am trying to pass the values of some standard and custom fields.

entry.title: HTML Controls Misbehaving in SAP – SE80 and Workflow task in Blank
entry.content:
Hello SAP Community,

I’m experiencing a strange issue in SAP (SAPGUI 800), some UI elements no longer work properly:

  • In SE80, within the Repository Browser, I cannot switch between function groups, packages, or other objects. Instead of the usual content, I only see a blank box.

  • Similarly, Workflow tasks appear completely blank.

I suspect this may be related to installing Adobe Designer for Adobe Forms, but I’m not entirely sure. I think it started malfunctioning since I installed it, although I only noticed it days later.

I couldn’t even access the SAP Community page at first—it kept giving me a “page not found” error. After clearing cookies, I was able to log in, though I’m not sure if it’s related; it might just be a coincidence.

Has anyone seen similar issues with HTML controls in SAP? Any suggestions on how to restore the normal behavior would be greatly appreciated.

Thank you!

entry.title: Add variant of main program to called program in a background job
entry.content:
TABLES : marc,aufm,indx, afko,afpo,afvc. TYPE-POOLS slis.
TYPES : BEGIN OF ty_aufm, matnr TYPE aufm-matnr, "material aufnr TYPE aufm-aufnr, "order no. bwart TYPE aufm-bwart, "movement type bldat TYPE aufm-bldat, "Posting date werks TYPE aufm-werks, "plant mblnr TYPE aufm-mblnr, mjahr TYPE aufm-mjahr, END OF ty_aufm. TYPES : BEGIN OF ty_marc, matnr TYPE marc-matnr, werks TYPE marc-werks, sernp TYPE marc-sernp, "serial no. profile. dispo TYPE marc-dispo, "mrp controller. END OF ty_marc. TYPES : BEGIN OF ty_afko, aufnr TYPE afko-aufnr, "order no gamng TYPE afko-gamng, "Total order quantity igmng TYPE afko-igmng, "Yield confirmed from order confirmation aufpl TYPE afko-aufpl, "routing no. END OF ty_afko. TYPES : BEGIN OF ty_afpo, aufnr TYPE afpo-aufnr, wemng TYPE afpo-wemng, "Quantity of goods received for the order item END OF ty_afpo. TYPES : BEGIN OF ty_afvc, * aufnr type afvc-aufnr, aufpl TYPE afvc-aufpl, "Routing number of operations in the order vornr TYPE afvc-vornr, "operation no./ avtivity no. steus TYPE afvc-steus, "control key objnr TYPE afvc-objnr, END OF ty_afvc.
TYPES : BEGIN OF ty_jest, objnr TYPE jest-objnr, stat TYPE jest-stat, END OF ty_jest.
TYPES : BEGIN OF ty_output, checkbox(1) TYPE c, aufnr TYPE aufm-aufnr, "order no. werks TYPE aufm-werks, "plant matnr TYPE aufm-matnr, "material bldat TYPE aufm-bldat, "Posting date gamng TYPE afko-gamng, "Total order quantity wemng TYPE afpo-wemng, "gr quantity igmng TYPE afko-igmng, "Yield confirmed from order confirmation unconfirmed_quant TYPE afko-igmng, "unconfirmed quantity vornr TYPE afvc-vornr, steus TYPE afvc-steus, aufpl TYPE afko-aufpl, status TYPE zmass_msg_log-status, field_style TYPE lvc_t_styl, line_color(4), color TYPE lvc_t_scol, END OF ty_output.
" start of ch03 TYPES :BEGIN OF ty_tbtco, jobname TYPE tbtco-jobname, jobcount TYPE tbtco-jobcount, sdluname TYPE tbtco-sdluname, status TYPE tbtco-status, sdlstrtdt TYPE tbtco-sdlstrtdt, sdlstrttm TYPE tbtco-sdlstrttm, END OF ty_tbtco . DATA : it_tbtco TYPE TABLE OF ty_tbtco, wa_tbtco TYPE ty_tbtco, finished TYPE tbtcv-fin, aborted TYPE tbtcv-abort, scheduled TYPE tbtcv-sched. TYPES : BEGIN OF ty_count, count TYPE i, END OF ty_count. DATA : it_count TYPE TABLE OF ty_count.
* end of ch03 DATA: it_msg TYPE TABLE OF zmass_msg_log, wa_msg TYPE zmass_msg_log. DATA : it_aufm TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF ty_aufm, wa_aufm TYPE ty_aufm, it_marc TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF ty_marc, wa_marc TYPE ty_marc, it_afpo TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF ty_afpo, wa_afpo TYPE ty_afpo, it_afko TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF ty_afko, wa_afko TYPE ty_afko, it_afvc TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF ty_afvc, wa_afvc TYPE ty_afvc, it_jest TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF ty_jest, wa_jest TYPE ty_jest, it_afvc1 TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF ty_afvc, wa_afvc1 TYPE ty_afvc, it_bapi TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF ty_output, lv_batch_user TYPE syuname, lv_variant TYPE rsvar-variant, wa_bapi TYPE ty_output, "manish start it_sel1 TYPE TABLE OF rsparams, * lv_variant TYPE rsvar-variant, wa_varid TYPE varid, lv_jobname TYPE tbtcjob-jobname, lv_jobcount TYPE tbtcjob-jobcount, it_varit TYPE TABLE OF varit, * lv_batch_user TYPE syuname, "manish end idx TYPE sy-tabix. DATA : c_success TYPE i, c_error TYPE i. DATA : lv_flag TYPE c, lv_var1 TYPE c, lv_var2 TYPE c, lv_var3 TYPE c, lv_var4 TYPE c. DATA : lv_yes TYPE c. DATA : lv_index3 TYPE sy-index. DATA : time1 TYPE tbtcjob-sdlstrttm, date1 TYPE tbtcjob-sdlstrtdt, time2 TYPE sy-uzeit, date2 TYPE sy-datum. ********************************************************************* * bapi parameters. ********************************************************************* DATA :it_timetckt LIKE bapi_pp_timeticket OCCURS 0, it_goodsmov LIKE bapi2017_gm_item_create OCCURS 0, return1 TYPE bapiret1, wa_timetckt LIKE LINE OF it_timetckt, detail_return LIKE bapi_coru_return OCCURS 0, wa_detail_return LIKE LINE OF detail_return. ********************************************************************* * data declaration for alv ********************************************************************* DATA: g_custom_container TYPE REF TO cl_gui_custom_container, g_grid TYPE REF TO cl_gui_alv_grid, it_fieldcat TYPE lvc_t_fcat, ls_fieldcat TYPE lvc_s_fcat, ls_layout TYPE lvc_s_layo. DATA: pos TYPE i. DATA ls_variant TYPE disvariant. DATA :lvc_selfield TYPE lvc_s_stbl.
DATA: w_toolbar TYPE stb_button. DATA: mt_toolbar TYPE ttb_button."stb_button. DATA: ta_func TYPE ui_functions,ls_func TYPE ui_func.
DATA: ls_stylerow TYPE lvc_s_styl, lt_styletab TYPE lvc_t_styl, wa_cellcolor TYPE lvc_s_scol.
*************************BACKGROUND JOB*********************** DATA : v_jobhead LIKE tbtcjob. DATA : v_jobcount LIKE tbtcjob-jobcount. DATA: v_stepcount TYPE btcstepcnt. DATA : v_eventparm LIKE tbtcjob-eventparm. DATA : v_flg_released TYPE c. DATA: e_error. DATA: running LIKE tbtcv-run.
TYPES: esp1_boolean LIKE boole-boole.
CONSTANTS: esp1_false TYPE esp1_boolean VALUE ' ', esp1_true TYPE esp1_boolean VALUE 'X'.
CONSTANTS: true TYPE boolean VALUE esp1_true, false TYPE boolean VALUE esp1_false.
DATA : v_jobnam LIKE tbtcjob-jobname, v_report LIKE sy-repid, v_varian LIKE raldb-variant, v_uname LIKE sy-uname, priparams TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF pri_params, wa_priparams TYPE pri_params. DATA:it_err TYPE TABLE OF zmass_msg_log, wa_err TYPE zmass_msg_log. DATA :idx1 TYPE sy-tabix, v_afvc_idx TYPE sy-tabix, v_flag TYPE flag. DATA v_not_mile TYPE flag. DATA : v_mile TYPE i, v_dsel TYPE flag, v_sel TYPE flag. *----------------------------------------------------------------------
********************************************************************** * selection screen declaration. ***********************************************************************
SELECTION-SCREEN BEGIN OF BLOCK a1 WITH FRAME TITLE text-003 . "t1. PARAMETERS : r1 RADIOBUTTON GROUP rg1 USER-COMMAND uc, " DEFAULT 'X' , r2 RADIOBUTTON GROUP rg1. SELECTION-SCREEN END OF BLOCK a1 .
SELECTION-SCREEN BEGIN OF BLOCK a2 WITH FRAME TITLE text-004." t2. SELECTION-SCREEN SKIP 1. SELECT-OPTIONS : plant FOR marc-werks NO INTERVALS NO-EXTENSION OBLIGATORY, date FOR sy-datum DEFAULT sy-datum OBLIGATORY. SELECTION-SCREEN END OF BLOCK a2.
AT SELECTION-SCREEN OUTPUT. "PBO ** SELECT * FROM zmass_msg_log INTO CORRESPONDING FIELDS OF TABLE it_msg WHERE user_name = sy-uname ORDER BY last_login DESCENDING.
READ TABLE it_msg INTO wa_msg INDEX 1. MESSAGE i004(zauto) WITH wa_msg-user_name wa_msg-last_login. REFRESH it_msg. CLEAR wa_msg.
START-OF-SELECTION. IF date-high IS INITIAL. MOVE : sy-datum TO date-high, 'BT' TO date-option. MODIFY date INDEX 1. ENDIF.
END-OF-SELECTION.
IF r1 = 'X'. IF sy-batch = abap_true. PERFORM background_processing. ENDIF.
time1 = sy-timlo. date1 = sy-datum.
IF it_bapi[] IS INITIAL. PERFORM data_fetch. ENDIF. IF it_bapi IS INITIAL. MESSAGE i002(zauto) WITH 'Data not found.'. ENDIF.
REFRESH: it_msg.
LOOP AT it_bapi INTO wa_bapi. CALL FUNCTION 'CONVERSION_EXIT_ALPHA_OUTPUT' EXPORTING input = wa_bapi-aufnr IMPORTING output = wa_bapi-aufnr. MODIFY it_bapi FROM wa_bapi TRANSPORTING aufnr. ENDLOOP.
IF it_bapi[] IS NOT INITIAL. SELECT * FROM zmass_msg_log INTO CORRESPONDING FIELDS OF TABLE it_msg FOR ALL ENTRIES IN it_bapi WHERE order_no = it_bapi-aufnr AND plant_used = it_bapi-werks .
ENDIF.
LOOP AT it_bapi INTO wa_bapi. idx = sy-tabix. READ TABLE it_msg INTO wa_msg WITH KEY order_no = wa_bapi-aufnr plant_used = wa_bapi-werks. "ch01 IF sy-subrc = 0. * IF wa_msg-status = 'E'. IF wa_msg-status = 'E'. wa_bapi-line_color = 'C611'. ELSEIF wa_msg-status = 'M'. wa_bapi-line_color = 'C310'. ELSEIF wa_msg-status = 'T'. wa_bapi-line_color = 'C710'. ENDIF. ENDIF. wa_bapi-status = wa_msg-status. "ch01 MODIFY it_bapi FROM wa_bapi INDEX idx TRANSPORTING line_color field_style status. CLEAR : idx,wa_bapi. ENDLOOP.
DELETE it_bapi WHERE unconfirmed_quant = '0.000'. LOOP AT it_bapi INTO wa_bapi WHERE checkbox IS NOT INITIAL. READ TABLE it_msg INTO wa_msg WITH KEY order_no = wa_bapi-aufnr. IF sy-subrc = 0. DELETE it_bapi WHERE status = 'I'. ENDIF. ENDLOOP.
LOOP AT it_bapi INTO wa_bapi WHERE status <> 'E'. idx = sy-tabix. IF wa_bapi-line_color IS NOT INITIAL OR wa_bapi-unconfirmed_quant < 0. ls_stylerow-fieldname = 'CHECKBOX'. ls_stylerow-style = cl_gui_alv_grid=>mc_style_disabled. APPEND ls_stylerow TO wa_bapi-field_style. ENDIF.
MODIFY it_bapi FROM wa_bapi INDEX idx TRANSPORTING line_color field_style. CLEAR : idx,wa_bapi. ENDLOOP.
lv_flag = 'X'. v_sel = 'X'.
LOOP AT it_bapi INTO wa_bapi WHERE field_style IS INITIAL."line_color IS INITIAL OR status = 'E' . idx = sy-tabix. wa_bapi-checkbox = 'X'. MODIFY it_bapi FROM wa_bapi INDEX idx. CLEAR :idx,wa_bapi. ENDLOOP.
* DELETE it_bapi WHERE checkbox EQ ''. <--database table is getting updated with all rows
REFRESH: it_msg. IF it_bapi[] IS NOT INITIAL. SELECT * FROM zmass_msg_log INTO CORRESPONDING FIELDS OF TABLE it_msg FOR ALL ENTRIES IN it_bapi WHERE order_no = it_bapi-aufnr AND plant_used = it_bapi-werks . ENDIF.
DELETE it_bapi WHERE unconfirmed_quant = '0.000'.
LOOP AT it_bapi INTO wa_bapi WHERE checkbox IS NOT INITIAL. READ TABLE it_msg INTO wa_msg WITH KEY order_no = wa_bapi-aufnr. IF sy-subrc = 0. DELETE it_bapi WHERE status = 'I'. ENDIF. ENDLOOP.
IF sy-batch = abap_true.
CALL FUNCTION 'GET_JOB_RUNTIME_INFO' IMPORTING * EVENTID = * EVENTPARM = * EXTERNAL_PROGRAM_ACTIVE = jobcount = v_jobcount jobname = v_jobnam stepcount = v_stepcount EXCEPTIONS no_runtime_info = 1 OTHERS = 2. IF sy-subrc <> 0. * Implement suitable error handling here ENDIF.
ELSE. v_jobnam = sy-repid.
ENDIF. *&-------------------------------------------------- * start of ch03 *&-------------------------------------------------- IF sy-batch = ''. SELECT jobname jobcount sdluname status sdlstrtdt sdlstrttm FROM tbtco INTO TABLE it_tbtco WHERE jobname = v_jobnam ORDER BY sdlstrtdt DESCENDING sdlstrttm DESCENDING. IF it_tbtco IS NOT INITIAL. "AVJ01 READ TABLE it_tbtco INTO wa_tbtco INDEX 1. BREAK-POINT. IF wa_tbtco-status NE 'F' AND wa_tbtco-status NE 'A' . MESSAGE e006(zauto) WITH wa_tbtco-sdluname. * MESSAGE i006(zauto) WITH wa_tbtco-sdluname. * LEAVE TO SCREEN 0. ENDIF. ENDIF. ENDIF. *&--------------------------------------------------------- * end of change ch03 *&--------------------------------------------------------- "
CALL FUNCTION 'JOB_OPEN' EXPORTING jobname = v_jobnam * sdlstrtdt = date1 "ch03 * sdlstrttm = time1 "ch03 IMPORTING jobcount = v_jobcount EXCEPTIONS cant_create_job = 1 invalid_job_data = 2 jobname_missing = 3 OTHERS = 4.
IF sy-subrc = 0. CALL FUNCTION 'GET_PRINT_PARAMETERS' EXPORTING copies = count cover_page = 'X' department = 'System' destination = 'LP01' expiration = 9 immediately = ' ' layout = 'X_65_255' line_count = 60 line_size = 255 list_name = 'ZV60' list_text = 'ZV60' new_list_id = 'X' no_dialog = 'X' receiver = 'SAP*' release = 'X' sap_cover_page = 'X' IMPORTING out_parameters = params valid = valid.
indx-aedat = sy-datum. indx-usera = sy-uname.
DELETE FROM zscm_auto_conf3 WHERE aufnr NE '' . MOVE-CORRESPONDING it_bapi[] TO izscm_auto_conf3[] . MODIFY zscm_auto_conf3 FROM TABLE izscm_auto_conf3[].
lv_batch_user = sy-uname. lv_variant = 'MANISH'. DATA: lv_rep TYPE sy-repid VALUE 'ZSCM_AUTO_CONF3_NEW_COPY'.
CALL FUNCTION 'JOB_SUBMIT' EXPORTING jobcount = v_jobcount jobname = v_jobnam report = lv_rep " <-- your background report variant = lv_variant authcknam = lv_batch_user " <-- requires S_BTCH_NAM auth * targetsystem = ' ' " keep local priparams = params EXCEPTIONS OTHERS = 1. IF sy-subrc <> 0. MESSAGE 'JOB_SUBMIT failed.' TYPE 'E'. ENDIF.
IF sy-subrc = 0. CALL FUNCTION 'JOB_CLOSE' EXPORTING jobcount = v_jobcount jobname = v_jobnam sdlstrtdt = date1 "ch03 sdlstrttm = time1 "ch03 * strtimmed = 'X' "ch03 IMPORTING job_was_released = v_flg_released EXCEPTIONS cant_start_immediate = 1 invalid_startdate = 2 jobname_missing = 3 job_close_failed = 4 job_nosteps = 5 job_notex = 6 lock_failed = 7 OTHERS = 8. IF sy-subrc = 0. DO. CALL FUNCTION 'SHOW_JOBSTATE' EXPORTING jobcount = v_jobcount jobname = v_jobnam EXCEPTIONS jobcount_missing = 1 jobname_missing = 2 job_notex = 3 OTHERS = 4.
IF sy-subrc <> 0. e_error = true. MESSAGE ID sy-msgid TYPE sy-msgty NUMBER sy-msgno WITH sy-msgv1 sy-msgv2 sy-msgv3 sy-msgv4. ENDIF. IF running = space. EXIT. ENDIF. ENDDO. ENDIF. ENDIF. ENDIF. ENDFORM.
REPORT zscm_auto_conf3_new_copy. TABLES : marc,aufm,indx, afko,afpo,afvc. TYPE-POOLS slis.
TYPES : BEGIN OF ty_aufm, matnr TYPE aufm-matnr, "material aufnr TYPE aufm-aufnr, "order no. bwart TYPE aufm-bwart, "movement type bldat TYPE aufm-bldat, "Posting date werks TYPE aufm-werks, "plant mblnr TYPE aufm-mblnr, mjahr TYPE aufm-mjahr, END OF ty_aufm. TYPES : BEGIN OF ty_marc, matnr TYPE marc-matnr, werks TYPE marc-werks, sernp TYPE marc-sernp, "serial no. profile. dispo TYPE marc-dispo, "mrp controller. END OF ty_marc. TYPES : BEGIN OF ty_afko, aufnr TYPE afko-aufnr, "order no gamng TYPE afko-gamng, "Total order quantity igmng TYPE afko-igmng, "Yield confirmed from order confirmation aufpl TYPE afko-aufpl, "routing no. END OF ty_afko. TYPES : BEGIN OF ty_afpo, aufnr TYPE afpo-aufnr, wemng TYPE afpo-wemng, "Quantity of goods received for the order item END OF ty_afpo. TYPES : BEGIN OF ty_afvc, * aufnr type afvc-aufnr, aufpl TYPE afvc-aufpl, "Routing number of operations in the order vornr TYPE afvc-vornr, "operation no./ avtivity no. steus TYPE afvc-steus, "control key END OF ty_afvc. TYPES : BEGIN OF ty_output, checkbox(1) TYPE c, aufnr TYPE aufm-aufnr, "order no. werks TYPE aufm-werks, "plant matnr TYPE aufm-matnr, "material bldat TYPE aufm-bldat, "Posting date gamng TYPE afko-gamng, "Total order quantity wemng TYPE afpo-wemng, "gr quantity igmng TYPE afko-igmng, "Yield confirmed from order confirmation unconfirmed_quant TYPE afko-igmng, "unconfirmed quantity vornr TYPE afvc-vornr, steus TYPE afvc-steus, aufpl TYPE afko-aufpl, status TYPE zmass_msg_log-status, field_style TYPE lvc_t_styl, line_color(4), color TYPE lvc_t_scol, END OF ty_output. DATA: it_msg TYPE TABLE OF zmass_msg_log, wa_msg TYPE zmass_msg_log. DATA : it_aufm TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF ty_aufm, wa_aufm TYPE ty_aufm, it_marc TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF ty_marc, wa_marc TYPE ty_marc, it_afpo TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF ty_afpo, wa_afpo TYPE ty_afpo, it_afko TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF ty_afko, wa_afko TYPE ty_afko, it_afvc TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF ty_afvc, wa_afvc TYPE ty_afvc, it_afvc1 TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF ty_afvc, wa_afvc1 TYPE ty_afvc, it_bapi TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF ty_output, wa_bapi TYPE ty_output, idx TYPE sy-tabix. DATA : c_success TYPE i, c_error TYPE i. DATA : lv_flag TYPE c, lv_var1 TYPE c, lv_var2 TYPE c, lv_var3 TYPE c, lv_variant TYPE rsvar-variant, lv_var4 TYPE c. DATA : lv_yes TYPE c. DATA : lv_index3 TYPE sy-index. DATA : time1 TYPE sy-timlo, date1 TYPE dats. ********************************************************************* * bapi parameters. ********************************************************************* DATA :it_timetckt LIKE bapi_pp_timeticket OCCURS 0, it_goodsmov LIKE bapi2017_gm_item_create OCCURS 0, return1 TYPE bapiret1, * return TYPE bapiret2, "avj03 Change Sj001 'Commented the code' wa_timetckt LIKE LINE OF it_timetckt, detail_return LIKE bapi_coru_return OCCURS 0, wa_detail_return LIKE LINE OF detail_return. *DATA : it_bapiret2 TYPE bapiret2. " change SJ-001 DATA: w_toolbar TYPE stb_button. DATA: mt_toolbar TYPE ttb_button."stb_button. DATA: ta_func TYPE ui_functions,ls_func TYPE ui_func.
DATA: ls_stylerow TYPE lvc_s_styl, lt_styletab TYPE lvc_t_styl, wa_cellcolor TYPE lvc_s_scol.
DATA:it_err TYPE TABLE OF zmass_msg_log, wa_err TYPE zmass_msg_log. DATA :idx1 TYPE sy-tabix, v_afvc_idx TYPE sy-tabix, v_flag TYPE flag. DATA v_not_mile TYPE flag. DATA : v_mile TYPE i, v_dsel TYPE flag, v_sel TYPE flag. *************************BACKGROUND JOB*********************** DATA : v_jobhead LIKE tbtcjob. DATA : v_jobcount LIKE tbtcjob-jobcount. DATA : v_eventparm LIKE tbtcjob-eventparm. DATA : v_flg_released TYPE c. DATA: e_error. DATA: running LIKE tbtcv-run.
TYPES: esp1_boolean LIKE boole-boole.
CONSTANTS: esp1_false TYPE esp1_boolean VALUE ' ', esp1_true TYPE esp1_boolean VALUE 'X'.
CONSTANTS: true TYPE boolean VALUE esp1_true, false TYPE boolean VALUE esp1_false.
DATA : v_jobnam LIKE tbtcjob-jobname, v_report LIKE sy-repid, v_varian LIKE raldb-variant, v_uname LIKE sy-uname. DATA: indxkey LIKE indx-srtfd VALUE 'KEY'. ***********************END BCK JOB*******************************
******************************************* *start of change by HM001
SELECTION-SCREEN BEGIN OF BLOCK a2 WITH FRAME TITLE text-004." t2. SELECTION-SCREEN SKIP 1. SELECT-OPTIONS : plant FOR marc-werks NO INTERVALS NO-EXTENSION OBLIGATORY, date FOR sy-datum DEFAULT sy-datum OBLIGATORY. SELECTION-SCREEN END OF BLOCK a2.
AUTHORITY-CHECK OBJECT 'S_TCODE' ID 'TCD' FIELD 'ZCPAUTOCONF'.
IF sy-subrc <> 0. MESSAGE 'You are not authorized to use Transaction ZCPAUTOCONF' TYPE 'E'. ENDIF. SELECT * FROM zscm_auto_conf3 INTO TABLE @DATA(izscm_auto_conf3) WHERE aufnr NE ''. IF sy-subrc EQ 0. MOVE-CORRESPONDING izscm_auto_conf3[] TO it_bapi[]. ENDIF. LOOP AT it_bapi INTO wa_bapi WHERE checkbox = 'X'.
CALL FUNCTION 'ENQUEUE_ESORDER' EXPORTING aufnr = wa_bapi-aufnr EXCEPTIONS foreign_lock = 1 system_failure = 2 OTHERS = 3.
CALL FUNCTION 'CONVERSION_EXIT_ALPHA_OUTPUT' EXPORTING input = wa_bapi-aufnr IMPORTING output = wa_bapi-aufnr. wa_timetckt-orderid = wa_bapi-aufnr. CALL FUNCTION 'CONVERSION_EXIT_ALPHA_INPUT' EXPORTING input = wa_timetckt-orderid IMPORTING output = wa_timetckt-orderid.
wa_timetckt-operation = wa_bapi-vornr. wa_timetckt-postg_date = sy-datum. wa_timetckt-plant = wa_bapi-werks. wa_timetckt-yield = wa_bapi-unconfirmed_quant. APPEND wa_timetckt TO it_timetckt.
CALL FUNCTION 'BAPI_PRODORDCONF_CREATE_TT' IMPORTING return = return1 TABLES timetickets = it_timetckt detail_return = detail_return. CLEAR : wa_msg. LOOP AT detail_return INTO wa_detail_return.
CALL FUNCTION 'CONVERSION_EXIT_ALPHA_OUTPUT' EXPORTING input = wa_detail_return-message_v1 IMPORTING output = wa_detail_return-message_v1. wa_msg-order_no = wa_bapi-aufnr. wa_msg-time = sy-timlo. wa_msg-plant_used = wa_bapi-werks. wa_msg-material = wa_bapi-matnr. wa_msg-confirmed_date = wa_bapi-bldat. wa_msg-message = wa_detail_return-message. wa_msg-status = wa_detail_return-type. wa_msg-user_name = sy-uname. wa_msg-last_login = sy-datum. wa_msg-mandt = sy-mandt.
MODIFY zmass_msg_log FROM wa_msg. " change SJ-001 COMMIT WORK. " change SJ-001 IF wa_detail_return-type = 'S' OR wa_detail_return-type = 'I'. c_success = c_success + 1. ELSEIF wa_detail_return-type = 'E' OR wa_detail_return-type = 'W' OR wa_detail_return-type IS INITIAL. c_error = c_error + 1. ENDIF. CLEAR : wa_detail_return. ",return1,return. " avj03 Change SJ001 'Commented the code' ENDLOOP.
CALL FUNCTION 'DEQUEUE_ESORDER' EXPORTING aufnr = wa_bapi-aufnr. WAIT UP TO lv_val SECONDS. CLEAR : wa_bapi,wa_timetckt."wa_msg, REFRESH : it_timetckt,detail_return. ENDLOOP. EXPORT wa_msg TO MEMORY ID 'MSG' . CLEAR : wa_msg. MESSAGE i003(zauto) WITH c_success c_error. CLEAR : c_error,c_success. REFRESH : it_bapi,it_msg.

I have a main program (ZMANISH_BACKGROUND) which has a selection screen as shown.

The above program will be executed in the background via SM36. A variant will be created after entering the plant and date and this particular variant will be provided in SM36 with the jobname and the program name.

 

The main program ZMANISH_BACKGROUND is submitting another program ZSCM_AUTO_CONF3_NEW which is also triggered in the background. This program has no parameters.

When the job is scheduled and I go to SM37 I can see 2 jobs, one for the main program and the other for the called program. Below are my questions:

1) Since both programs are running in the background, 2 jobs are getting created, one with a spool (ZSCM_AUTO_CONF3_NEW) and the other without a spool (ZMANISH_BACKGROUND).

 

Is it possible to delete the job without the spool programmatically ? The functional wants only the job with the spool to be displayed.

2) The job without the spool displays the variant name which was saved .

 

However the job with the spool displays a system generated number as the variant

 

Is it possible to insert the variant 'MANISH'  to the job with the spool , instead of the random number being generated ?

Thanks!

Manish

entry.title: Something weird happened in ALV output. How to change the font style in the ALV output?
entry.content:
Hi All,

I am practicing on a training SAP system and it seems some has changed the global settings. All the screens that appear in ALV grid are showing the font as italic, underlined, strike through and vertical. I have checked all over and could not figure out.

I tried to change the layout and several other settings, but this is how the screen looks in every ALV view. This issue is there for every screen irrespective of standard or custom. Kindly suggest a solution for this. Thanks in advance.

entry.title: Use BTP Malware Service with VSCAN (VSI) - Detect hidden code in metadata of image file
entry.content:
Hi,

I have a requirement where we need to scan files uploaded via a Fiori application for malware (in our case attachments for a leave request). After some research I came across this amazing github project ( https://github.com/gregorwolf/sap-malware-scanning-vsi ) that explains how you can use the BTP malware service via the VSI BAdI to do your virus/malware scanning. 

We initiated the BTP Malware instance, created the SM59 config, created all the classes and interfaces as per the github project, implemented the BADI and created the basic VSI configuration. 

 

 

 

Now that all seems to be working correctly. When I use VSCANTEST with the standard Eicar test virus, it correctly detects the virus.

However when I try something more complex like hiding executable PHP code within the metadata of an image file, it does not detect this as malware :(. I tried searching through all available documentation, and it seems as if the VSI profile configuration options where you specify MIME types for active content is only if you configure a malware service via VSI and not when you use the BADI?

Has anyone tried this before where you use the VSI BADI to call a malware scanning service (Like the BTP one) and scan for things like PHP code in metadata? How I do that?

Kind Regards

Deon

entry.title: How to use BAPI_SALESORDER_CHANGE properly? Encountered CX_SY_DYN_ILLEGAL_CALL_TYPE
entry.content:
I am encountering a dump of CX_SY_DYN_ILLEGAL_CALL_TYPE when using the BAPI_SALESORDER_CHANGE. It is my first time to use this.
I am trying to pass specific fields from contract document into sales document but for now, i am trying to pass a specific value in sales document when the contract document is saved. 

  DATA: ls_header_in    TYPE bapisdhd1,
        ls_header_inx   TYPE bapisdhd1x,
        lt_return       TYPE TABLE OF bapiret2,
        ls_return       TYPE bapiret2,
        lv_salesdocnum  TYPE vbeln_va, 
        lv_has_error    TYPE abap_bool.

  IF xvbak-auart <> 'ZVCC'.
    RETURN.
  ENDIF.

  " Get related sales order
  SELECT SINGLE vbeln
    FROM vbfa
    WHERE vbelv = @xvbak-vbeln
      AND vbtyp_n = 'C'
      AND vbtyp_v = 'G'
    INTO _salesdocnum. 

  IF sy-subrc <> 0.
    RETURN.
  ENDIF.

  CLEAR: ls_header_in, 
         ls_header_inx, 
         lt_return.

  " Set values
  ls_header_in-purch_no_c  = 'ZTEST_CHANGE01'.
  ls_header_inx-purch_no_c = 'X'.
  ls_header_inx-updateflag = 'U'.

  CALL FUNCTION 'BAPI_SALESORDER_CHANGE'
    EXPORTING
      salesdocument    = lv_salesdocnum 
      order_header_in  = ls_header_in    
      order_header_inx = ls_header_inx   
    TABLES
      return           = lt_return.

entry.content:

Flow: Create or Edit Contract Document, when saved, the desired fields values of contract document header should be passed into the sales document header.
